title: League won't open after clicking .exe
body:
Every time i try to open it, the first logo appears for a split second, then the second one with the bar beneath it, after that nothing happens. both processes appear in task manager briefly but then nothing related to LoL remains. I've tried re-installing completely, deleting files specified in old threads and re-opening, re-starting my computer, it has been allowed through my anti-virus, i have a stable internet connection. Help please
Update: I now think it's a problem with the patcher itself, or maybe something is still blocking it's connection to the internet somehow. I tried reinstalling to a different directory, however once it got to the logo with the progress bar beneath, it loaded until about 1/3 of the way and crashed. Now it's back to the original problem.

replies.body:
That's strange. For the launcher to just not show up, even after a fresh reinstall.

Have you tried running it in admin mode?
Yeah, that's one of the first things i tried. And then again after each different attempt.
How old is your computer? Is the OS Windows XP?
No, it's windows 7. it's a fairly new computer, probably not even a year old yet.

Well, I don't think it has a problem connecting to the internet. You aren't getting the "Could not connect to internet, check your firewall" error message. It seems like something more preliminary, that's preventing the process from opening at all.

Open up your Task Manager. Describe the events that happen when you attempt to open League, noting things like how many seconds it takes to crash/how long it is to when it disappears from screen and when the process actually ends.

Then, try it again using compatibility mode (try compatibility for Windows XP with SP).
First attempt, both LoLPatcher and LoLLauncher processes open for 3 seconds. Using compatibility mode didn't seem to make a difference. Nothing related to league remains afterwards

And not even Windows thinks it crashed, because you aren't getting dialogues from its bug-splat afterward.

Do make a support ticket out of this, because it seems very individual.

Installing goes completely fine, right? All other applications work without error?

Do you have Internet Explorer uninstalled/disabled?

Turns out it was either a program called D3DGear or CyberLink video editor stopping it from patching. I have absolutely no clue why though. As soon as i deleted both of those it started working again. I Guess that's what i get for illegally downloading these things right? Thanks anyway for trying to help man, you're a true hero!

Oh yeah, malicious software exists. I kinda forgot that, with all this anti-virus I have now.

Eh.

It may not have actually been those softwares that stopped League from working, but something which was packaged with those softwares. Best way to avoid that is to just acquire them legally; that way even if the program causes League to stop working, you can bring it up with their support.

Glad to have helped!
